website_summaries.verdict: JBL's Clip+ takes an already well-designed, travel-friendly and affordable Bluetooth speaker and adds water resistance.
pros: The JBL Clip+ Bluetooth speaker is a compact, hockey-puck size speaker that has a built-in lithium ion rechargeable battery, offers decent enough sound for its size, and is water-resistant
It also has an integrated line-in cable that stows away in the bottom of the device, as well as speakerphone capabilities
cons: It doesn't handle big bass well and distorts at higher volumes

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality, not enough volume
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to love it but it's just not loud enough for my needs. Even with daisychaining it to other Clips it wasn't loud enough. I lead bike convoys that need music for everyone involved. I really need a Megaboom, I think, but this was my first attempt at "small and portable, but loud." Sadly not so. But my boyfriend has this exact one, rubberbanded to the breast of his backpack strap, and he LOVES it. The sound quality is great, and when it's that close to your ear, sure, it's plenty loud. But for my needs, not so much.

customer_reviews.title: Sadly Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: well I wanted this to be an excellent product, I was sadly disappointed. customer_reviews.title: Two Steps Back (and forty wasted dollars)
customer_reviews.text: This step up from the original design is crippled by one maddening, and apparently insurmountable flaw: the charge mechanics. When the battery drains--and it will in about three hours from full charge--it will be nearly impossible to re-charge. I see from other accounts that many of us have had the same experience. Sometimes it will appear as if it is charging, but play it and ten minutes later it's dead. And those are the good times. Most often, it will not charge at all. Ultimate assessment: a 99% ripoff that should be removed from the amazon/amazon prime offerings.
